refnamediv.refpurpose: Prints at k-rate using a printf() style syntax, appends a new line

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Prints at k-rate using a printf() style syntax. This opcode is similar to printsk, the only difference being that println appends a new line to each message

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: "string" -- the text string to be printed. Can be up to 8192 characters and must be in double quotes.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: xval1, xval2, ... (optional) -- The k-rate values to be printed. These are specified in string with the standard C value specifier (%f, %d, %s etc.) in the order given.

refsect1.title: Print Output Formatting
refsect1.para:
All standard C language printf() control characters may be used. For example, if kval1 = 153.26789 then some common formatting options are:
%f prints with full precision: 153.26789
%5.2f prints: 153.26
%d prints integers-only: 153
%c treats kval1 as an ascii character code.
For more information about printf() formatting, consult any C language documentation.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the println opcode. It uses the file println.csd.
Example of the println opcode.
